ticket.title: Myssql bug when testing
ticket.original-body:
Hi, For begining I m not speek english very well, So be nice with my language.
I use win7, NetBeans 6.9.1, ruby 1.9.2, rails 3.0.3.
I use the tutorial above to learn about ruby on rails : http://netbeans.org/kb/docs/ruby/rapid-ruby-weblog.html I follow the tutorial up to the chapter "Validating Input" point 8. In this point I have the next error :
Test-unit version : 2.1.2 loaded (in C:/Users/jcourbat/Documents/NetBeansProjects/rubyweblog) Loaded suite C:/Ruby192/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rake/rake_test_loader Started E Finished in 2.362000 seconds.
1) Error: test_invalid_with_empty_attributes(PostTest): ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid: Mysql2::Error: Table 'rubyweblog_test.posts' doesn't exist: DELETE FROM `posts`
I do all the things in the tutorial. I try to do this through the cmd but same bug appears.
I hope you can help me because i search in a lot of forum but no answer.
Thanks

I use win7, NetBeans 6.9.1, ruby 1.9.2, rails 3.0.3.

I use the tutorial above to learn about ruby on rails :
http://netbeans.org/kb/docs/ruby/rapid-ruby-weblog.html
I follow the tutorial up to the chapter "Validating Input" point 8. In this point I have the next error :

(in C:/Users/jcourbat/Documents/NetBeansProjects/rubyweblog) Loaded suite C:/Ruby192/lib/ruby/1.9.1/rake/rake_test_loader
Started

Finished in 2.362000 seconds.

1) Error: test_invalid_with_empty_attributes(PostTest):
ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid: Mysql2::Error: Table 'rubyweblog_test.posts' doesn't exist: DELETE FROM posts

I do all the things in the tutorial. I try to do this through the cmd but same bug appears.

I hope you can help me because i search in a lot of forum but no answer.

Thanks

version.title: Myssql bug when testing

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
